abstract: Lee In-won, vice chairman at South Korean conglomerate Lotte Group, is found dead in town near Seoul of apparent suicide hours before scheduled appearance with prosecutors; South Korean officials have been investigating accusations of corruption at Lotte and other chaebols--family-owned conglomerates--to head off public discontent over growth income inequality and slowing economy.
lead_paragraph: The body of the vice chairman of the Lotte Group, Lee In-won, was found on Friday in what the authorities were said to consider a suicide.
snippet: The body of the vice chairman of the Lotte Group, Lee In-won, was found on Friday in what the authorities were said to consider a suicide....

headline.main: Lotte Executive Found Dead Amid South Korean Corruption Inquiry
headline.print_headline: Lotte Executive Found Dead as South Korea Investigates Company
